intro: Psychotria pungens, commonly known as the arrow poison plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It is notable for containing toxic alkaloids, which have been historically used by indigenous peoples for hunting purposes. Its botanical features make it an important subject in both ethnobotanical and pharmacological studies.
